DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy of two different corticosteroid ointment application regimens for the treatment of eczema (atopic dermatitis).
DOC.brief_title: A Study Comparing the Efficacy of Two Topical Steroid Application Regimens in Pediatric Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
DOC.criteria: Meet the clinical criteria for the diagnosis of atopic dermatitis Have disease over at least 5% of their total body surface area. Less than 18 years of age. Families able to comprehend written instructions in English and able to complete questionnaires with assistance if needed. Parents/guardians able to understand and willing to sign a parental permission form. Children between the ages of 717 years willing to sign an ageappropriate assent form. Patients who are allergic or intolerant of the topical medications employed in this study. Lack of followup after initial visit or regimen noncompliance. Patients who do not have access to a bathtub.
